CanvasLoader.name: CanvasLoader

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the placeholder div.

constructors.description:
CanvasLoader is a JavaScript UI library that draws and animates circular preloaders using the Canvas HTML object.
A CanvasLoader instance creates two canvas elements which are placed into a placeholder div (the id of the div has to be passed in the constructor). The second canvas is invisible and used for caching purposes only.
If no id is passed in the constructor, the canvas objects are paced in the document directly.

getRange.description: Returns the modified shape range in percent.

show.description: Shows the rendering of the loader animation.

setDensity.description: Sets the number of shapes drawn on the loader canvas.

getDiameter.description: Returns the diameter of the loader.

kill.description: Remove the CanvasLoader instance and all references.

hide.description: Stop the rendering of the loader animation and hides the loader.

addEl.description: Creates a new element with the tag and applies the passed properties on it.

getShape.description: Returns the type of the loader shapes.

setRange.description:
Sets the amount of the modified shapes in percent.
With this value the user can set what range of the shapes should be scaled and/or faded. The shapes that are out of this range will be scaled and/or faded with a minimum amount only.
This minimum amount is 0.1 which means every shape which is out of the range is scaled and/or faded to 10% of the original values.
The visually acceptable range value should be between 0.4 and 1.5.

getFPS.description: Returns the fps of the loader.

draw.description: Draw the shapes on the canvas

setAttr.description: Sets the attributes on the element

getColor.description: Returns the loader color in a hexadecimal form.

params.name: color
params.description: (String) The HEX color value to be converted to RGB

getRGB.description: Return the RGB values of the passed color.

getDensity.description: Returns the number of shapes drawn on the loader canvas.

params.name: id
params.description: String The id of the placeholder div.

setCSS.description: Sets the css properties on the element

getSpeed.description: Returns the speed of the loader animation.

setDiameter.description: Sets the diameter of the loader.

setColor.description: Sets hexadecimal color of the loader.

setSpeed.description:
Sets the speed of the loader animation.
This value tells the loader how many shapes to skip by each tick.
Using the right combination of the setFPS and the setSpeed methods allows the users to optimize the CPU usage of the loader whilst keeping the animation on a visually pleasing level.

setFading.description: Sets the fading of the loader shapes.

setFPS.description:
Sets the rendering frequency.
This value tells the loader how many times to refresh and modify the canvas in 1 second.
Using the right combination of the setSpeed and the setFPS methods allows the users to optimize the CPU usage of the loader whilst keeping the animation on a visually pleasing level.

getFading.description: Returns the fading of the loader shapes.

canvasSupport.description: Checks if the browser supports Canvas

setShape.description:
Sets the type of the loader shapes.

The acceptable values are:
  • 'circle'
  • 'square'
  • 'rectangle'
  • 'roundedRectangle'

canvas.description: The div we draw the shapes into.

container.description: The div we place the canvas object into.

fps.description: The FPS of the loader animation rendering.

density.description: The number of shapes drawn on the loader canvas.

color.description: The color of the loader shapes in HEX.

cacheContext.description: The context of the cache canvas.

colorRGB.description: The color of the loader shapes in RGB.

timer.description: Add a timer for the rendering.

shape.description: The type of the loader shapes.

cacheCanvas.description: The canvas we use for caching.

running.description: Tell if the loader rendering is running.

activeId.description: The active shape id for rendering.

ready.description: Tell if the canvas and its context is ready.

range.description: Sets the amount of the modified shapes in percent.

speed.description: The speed of the loader animation.

fading.description: The fading of the loader shapes.

CanvasLoader.description:
CanvasLoader is a JavaScript UI library that draws and animates circular preloaders using the Canvas HTML object.
A CanvasLoader instance creates two canvas elements which are placed into a placeholder div (the id of the div has to be passed in the constructor). The second canvas is invisible and used for caching purposes only.
If no id is passed in the constructor, the canvas objects are paced in the document directly.

This lightweight library uses the HTML5 canvas element to draw and animate the most popular preloader shapes (circle, rectangle, square and rounded rectangle).
The implementation is (hopefully) very simple and doesn't require any external libraries.
CanvasLoader.name: CanvasLoader
